newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open lower.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open lower.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were seen opening lower Tuesday following Friday's sharp fall, after the U.S. dollar firmed further overnight and steadier world stock markets reduced incentives to diversify into precious metals, traders said.
COMEX December gold was seen opening unchanged to down 50 cents an ounce from the previous close at $332.50, after the contract saw its highest levels since late July Monday.
In the bullion market, spot gold was quoted $327.30/80 early, compared to the London Tuesday morning fix at $327.60 and the New York close Monday around $328.20/70.
COMEX warehouse gold stocks slipped 161 ounces to 944,568 ounces in Monday's data, while COMEX silver stocks fell 411,661 ounces to 169,144,427 ounces.
COMEX September silver was called unchanged to down 0.5 cent from Monday's close of $4.44.
NYMEX October platinum was expected to open unchanged to down $1.00 from Monday's close of $442.00, with NYMEX September palladium called down $1.00 to $2.00 from the previous close of $222.00.
In overnight trade, TOCOM platinum and palladium prices ended lower.
late Monday, South Africa's Impala Platinum Holdings (Implats) said the week old strike at its refineries had ended.
